column2: I tripped and fell down on the stairs! Thank heavens I'm okay - I just have a few bruises. My doctor said I should treat it with chicory, which I hate because of its bitter taste. Though I won't be eating it, having to deal with it is just annoying.
But I don't want my bruises to get worse.

Since I rule over a large Greek population I eat quite a lot of Greek food. I've found that the Greeks love eating khorta, or greens, a bitter mix of plants and herbs. It is extremely bitter though. I don't know if I can ever get used to it...
Coffee. No man can live without it, where we are, myself included. It is a natural part of our diet. Most drink it bitter, but some make it sweet by adding sugar.
I prefer my coffee bitter, as is custom.
Sweet coffee is better. Without it it's too bitter.
Bitter! Olives can't be this bitter, who can eat them? How will anyone make olive oil? It seems the stock of olives I bought were too raw.
I've ate a lot of arugula lately in my salads. No wonder I've been feeling so... stimulated in certain ways. People say it's an aphrodisiac after all.
Good! Maybe this will last a long time...
I should eat cabbages, which will calm me down.
Spinach may taste bitter, but I eat it because I've found it makes me feel healthier and stronger. (I've heard rumors of a less bitter spinach in faraway lands, though.)
I'm strong to the finish because I eat my spniach!
You become healthier than most. (+0.5 health)
This character is feeling a bit more "stimulated" than normal. Their lover(s) better beware!
